alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 8:42PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Dakota, Carver, Scott and Hennepin Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...From Thursday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading stops at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 701.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday evening and continue rising to a crest of 702.5 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.5 feet on 03/24/1985. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
